        Parameters:
        values - "0f:ca:fe:de:ad:be:ef"
        Returns:
        [15, 5 ,2, 5, 17]
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the string can not be parsed

      • Zero

      • ZeroEnd

        public static java.lang.String ZeroEnd(int zeroNumber)
        Get a "0000..." string and the end with blank space ' '. ZeroEnd(3) will get "000 "
        Parameters:
        zeroNumber -
        Returns:
        "000000... "

      • ByteZero

        public static java.lang.String ByteZero(int byteLenth)
        Get a "0000..." string, the number of '0' is (2 * byteLength). (a byte 255's hex value is 0xff, so a byte 0's hex value is 00). ByteZero(3) will get "000000"
        Parameters:
        byteLenth -
        Returns:
        "000000..."

      • ByteZeroEnd

        public static java.lang.String ByteZeroEnd(int byteLenth)
        Get a "0000... " string, the number of '0' is (2 * byteLength). (a byte 255's hex value is 0xff, so a byte 0's hex value is 00). ByteZeroEnd(3) will get "000000 "
        Parameters:
        byteLenth -
        Returns:
        "000000..."

      • toHex

        public static java.lang.String toHex(byte byteVar)
        Get a byte's hex value string. e.g. toHex((byte)254) will get "fe", toHex((byte)3) will get "03".
        Parameters:
        byteVar - byte variable
        Returns:
        a string of the byte variable's hex value

      • toHex

        public static java.lang.String toHex(short shortVar)
        Get a short's hex value string. e.g. toHex((short)254) will get "00fe".
        Parameters:
        shortVar - short variable
        Returns:
        a string of the short variable's hex value

      • toHex

        public static java.lang.String toHex(int intVar)
        Get a int's hex value string, and end with ' '. e.g. toHex(254) will get "000000fe ".
        Parameters:
        intVar - int variable
        Returns:
        a string of the int variable's hex value

      • toHex

        public static java.lang.String toHex(long longVar)
        Get a long's hex value string, and end with ' '. e.g. toHex((long)254) will get "00000000 000000fe ".
        Parameters:
        longVar - long variable
        Returns:
        a string of the long variable's hex value
